content: I think it’s cool that you found the growth rate of CS/AM to dominate the growth rate of engineering, but would argue that this doesn’t necessarily make the Allston expansion a bad thing. The expansion is motivated more by current spaces and offices unable to house all SEAS faculty, not just non-CS/AM engineering faculty, as well as the current laboratories being much too cramped for even the small amount of engineers at Harvard. But definitely agree with the concern over less interaction between engineering/non-engineering studies as a result of this!
